intro: Aquilegia xinjiangensis, commonly known as the Xinjiang columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Xinjiang, China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant features a basal rosette of dark green, palmately lobed leaves, which are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically arranged in a raceme and bloom in late spring to early summer. Aquilegia xinjiangensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
